nodes.text: Pax Maripher was a human male involved with illegal gemstone trading with his partner Rahara Wick. Orphaned in a pirate attack as a child, Maripher was raised by protocol droids for the next fifteen years on a derelict starship, before being rescued by a Galactic Republic cruiser at the age of twenty. As a result, Maripher's behavior and mannerisms were distinctly unusual.
Later on after helping Jedi Qui-Gon Jinn and Obi-Wan Kenobi on the planet Pijal he helped break Rahara Wick out of enslavement by Czerka Corporation.
Pax Maripher first appeared in the canon novel Master & Apprentice, which was written by Claudia Gray and published in 2019. Gray imagined Maripher as being portrayed by actor Shaun Evans.

In an interview with StarWars.com, Gray described the process of creating Maripher, stating that he and his partner Wick were based on the dynamic of the characters from the Sherlock Holmes television series Elementary. As Wick's character was created as a "female, more no-nonsense Watson character," Maripher was designed from the beginning as a "know-it-all." Gray further developed the character by exploring how he had become that way, imagining him as having been raised by protocol droids.
